body.p: To His Excellency Thomas E Bramlete Govener of Kentucky Your petitioners would represent that at the last term of the Boyd Circuit court, held in November 1863, a judgment was rendered against Jabez Hold for Fifty-six Sixty-four dollars for Selling liquor to soldiers within five miles of a millatary Camp They further state that there was great contrarilty of opinion, among the witnesses whether the Camp was within five miles of the grocery kept by the said Hold, ^or not^ The said Hold had License at that time to sell liquor in small quantities and we do not believe that he intended to violate the Law as, there is great doubt about the distance from the Camp to the place where sold we therefore pray Your excellency to remit said fine

John. H..Eastham S. B. C
C. L. McConnell J, B, C, C
James W Riley C, B, C, C
H A Padge J P
Jasper Rawlins
Richard Adams J P
Laban T Moore
